title: Ticket #3461: Better recovery / error handling when DHCP request is NACK'd
description:
We need to dig into the handling of DHCP NACK's for an address request.

The DHCP server used by UW may hand out the same offer to several discovery packets. The first job to perform the OFFER will get the address and everyone else will get a NACK.

Right now, this should simply cause a starter failure and the job will be retried later. Mike says this is not always so; this should be investigated.

Ideally, we should implement more of the DHCP protocol's retry mechanisms in the code.
